definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
gear/brake/sluice/lock (on waterway)/electric switch or circuit breaker
old variant of 閘|闸[zha2]/sluice/lock (on waterway)

sentences.english: I am more sure now he is watching over us since the electric incident.
sentences.chinese: 我更相信他现在是保佑着我们，因为电闸事件。

sentences.english: So each time I had to shut off the power supply before I brought them in.
sentences.chinese: 所以每次抱他上来之前我都必须先把电闸打下来。

sentences.english: When you close the switch, it completes the circuit.
sentences.chinese: 合闸时，电闸就把电路接通了。

sentences.english: Oriental jade turn off the switch, Li San successfully got the picture in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 东方玉关掉了电闸，李三成功拿到了在密室里的画。

sentences.english: Do not switch on the electricity again until the power company has first checked your home.
sentences.chinese: 在供电局来您家做过安全检查之前，不要再合上电闸。

sentences.english: Turn off the switch when anything goes wrong with the machine.
sentences.chinese: 如果机器发生故障，就把电闸关上。

sentences.english: Do not switch on the electricity gin until the power compny hs first checked your home.
sentences.chinese: 在供电局来您家做过安全检查之前，不要再合上电闸。

sentences.english: The thermostat is nothing more than an electric switch that opens and closes itself at the proper temperature.
sentences.chinese: 恒温器只不过是一种到达适当温度就自动开关的电闸。

definition: (of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
